entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Late Latin vascellum, diminutive of Latin vas vase, vessel

def.dt: :a container (as a cask, bottle, kettle, cup, or bowl) for holding something
:a person into whom some quality (as grace) is infused a child of light, a true vessel of the Lord H. J. Laski
:a tube or canal (as an artery) in which a body fluid is contained and conveyed or circulated
:a conducting tube in the xylem of a vascular plant formed by the fusion and loss of end walls of a series of cells
:any of the vessels through which blood circulates in the body
